section.title: Overview
section.para: Various checks related to &sip; &uri;.
This module implements some URI related AAA or DB based tests.

section.title: &osips; Modules
section.para:
At least one of the following modules must be loaded before this module:
a &osips; database module .
an aaa protocol module .

section.title: External Libraries or Applications
section.para:
The following libraries or applications must be installed before running &osips; with this module loaded:
None.

section.title: aaa_url (string)
section.para: This is the url representing the AAA protocol used and the location of the configuration file of this protocol.

section.title: service_type (integer)
section.para: AAA service type used in aaa_does_uri_exist and aaa_does_uri_user_exist checks.

section.title: use_sip_uri_host (integer)
section.para: If zero, aaa_does_uri_exist sends to AAA server Request URI user@host in UserName attribute. If non-zero, aaa_does_uri_exist sends to AAA server Request URI user in UserName attribute and host in SIP-URI-Host attribute.

section.title: db_url (string)
section.para: &url; of the database to be used.
If the db_url string is not set, you will not be able to use the DB related functions.

section.title: db_table (string)
section.para: The DB table that should be used. Its possible to use the subscriber and uri table. If the uri table should be used, an additional parameter () must be set.

section.title: user_column (string)
section.para: Column holding usernames in the table.

section.title: domain_column (string)
section.para: Column holding domain in the table.

section.title: uriuser_column (string)
section.para: Column holding &uri; username in the table.

section.title: use_uri_table (integer)
section.para: Specify if the uri table should be used for checkings instead of subscriber table. A non-zero value means true.

section.title: use_domain (integer)
section.para: Specify if the domain part of the URI should be used to identify the users (along with username). This is useful in multi domain setups, a non-zero value means true.
This parameter is only evaluated for calls to does_uri_exist, all other functions checks the digest username and realm against the given username, if the uri table is used.
